intro: Linaria segetum, commonly known as the common toadflax, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant features bright yellow flowers with two lips, resembling those of snapdragons, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate along the stem, often with a slightly hairy texture. Linaria segetum thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
